sentences.english: A fatuous and self-indulgent ruler wouldn't spend much time reading and replying to memorials.
sentences.chinese: 一个昏君是不会用多少时间来批复奏疏的。

sentences.english: They think the last bad emperor they had was Mao, " he said."
sentences.chinese: 中国人认为，他们的末代昏君是毛。

sentences.english: When Qu Yuan was alive, he met a bad King. So, he had to commit suicide.
sentences.chinese: 因为屈原在世的时候碰到昏君，所以他才要自尽。

sentences.english: His calligraphy is the history headed, but also emotional prodigal son.
sentences.chinese: 后主是历史上的昏君，也是感情上的浪子。

sentences.english: The current reigning emperor is fatuous and self-indulgent, he just hunts in the hunting enclosure every day.
sentences.chinese: 现在的皇帝是个昏君，每天只知道在围场打猎。

sentences.english: King Zhou, the last king of the Shang Dynasty, is a fatuous and self-indulgent King.
sentences.chinese: 纣王，商朝的最后一个皇帝，是一位昏君。

definition: a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state
rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
laws and discipline of imperial court
official who dares speak frankly before the emperor
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
